text: To others and themselves the British have a reputation for being conservative——not in the narrow political sense, but in the sense of adherence to accepted ideas and unwilling to question them.The reputation comes partly from their history. For 900 years they have sufferedneitherasoreither neither invasion nor revolution (except in 1649 and 1688) nor disastrous defeat in war. Their monarchy survivesandwithoutwithneither without serious question.Under its normal  namepeopleleadershipenemyleadership the political arrangements have been so stable that, except for the two interruptions in the seventeenth century , they have been adopted throughout  aanythefewthe centuries to meet changing needs without violent changes. Britain, in 1978, was unique in managing without a written constitution; some fragmentary definitions of 1688 stillsurvivesurvivingsurvivessurvived survived .There had been bitter quarrels, social and economic as well as political, but the quarrels had been settled , usually by compromise.The underlyingcontinuecontinuitycontinuouscontinued continuity had not been broken.
